headline: SLB Was the Nvidia of the 1970s
summary: ? This is an online version of Spencer's Markets A.M. newsletter.  Nowadays for SLB, which reported quarterly results today, it's a far less exciting picture as many customers trim drilling budgets, with crude prices near a five-year low.  With demand slowing amid the trade war, the International Energy Agency just predicted excess supply of 4 million barrels a day next year.

headline: SLB Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Stock Is Dropping.
summary: FEATURE  Oilfield services provider SLB provider posted third-quarter earnings and revenue that topped analysts’ estimates, though management warned about continued uncertainty in the oil market. The company formerly known as Schlumberger reported adjusted earnings of 69 cents a share, which came in above the 65 cents a share analysts had forecast, according to FactSet.

headline: Schlumberger: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: THE HAGUE, Netherlands (AP) — Schlumberger NV (SLB) on Friday reported third-quarter net income of $739 million. On a per-share basis, the The Hague, Netherlands-based company said it had net income of 50 cents. Earnings, adjusted for costs related to mergers and acquisitions and non-recurring costs, came to 69 cents per share.

headline: SLB (NYSE:SLB) Valuation Update: Is the Recent Share Price Slump a Potential Opportunity?
summary: SLB (SLB) shares have traded sideways recently, reflecting muted investor sentiment in the energy sector. Over the past month, the stock has slipped about 7%, underperforming broader market indices. Revenue and net income growth, however, remain positive year over year. See our latest analysis for SLB. SLB’s share price has faced steady selling pressure for much of 2024, with a year-to-date share price return of -14.27% and a 1-year total shareholder return of -22.9%, highlighting a slump...
